title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. The Act redesignates provisions in Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, and adjusts the rate of payment for benefits. The amendments made by subsection (b) have an effective date. The amendments made by subsection (b) shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act, and apply to benefits paid for months beginning on or after that date. SEC. 3 amends the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code. The amendment takes effect upon enactment and applies to benefits paid from that date. SEC. 4 addresses the eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. The eligibility and rate of payment for benefits under chapter 15 of title 38, United States Code, are amended to include specific criteria and adjustments. The eligibility and rate of payment for benefits under chapter 15 of title 38, United States Code, are amended to include specific criteria and adjustments. Benefits paid to individuals in the United States who are citizens or lawful residents will not be subject to certain conditions, while benefits paid to individuals in the Republic of the Philippines will be at a rate of $100 per month. These amendments will take effect upon the enactment of the Act and apply to benefits starting from that date. SEC. 5. ELIGIBILITY OF FILIPINO VETERANS FOR HEALTH CARE IN THE UNITED STATES. The Secretary shall provide hospital and nursing home care to Commonwealth Army veterans and new Philippine Scouts as per section 1710 of title 38. SEC. 6. OUTPATIENT HEALTH CARE FOR VETERANS RESIDING IN THE PHILIPPINES. The amendment provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines, with a limit of $500,000 in expenditures per fiscal year. The Secretary is authorized to furnish care and services to veterans and scouts for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic. The amendment authorizes outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines, with a $500,000 limit per fiscal year. The Secretary can provide care for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic. Appropriations are available for this purpose. The amendments authorize outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines, with a $500,000 limit per fiscal year. The effective date of these amendments is the enactment of the Act.
